Message.Title: KKK, a crazy white man terror tradition
Message.Msg: 1927: The Ku Klux Klan launch a wave of political terror in Alabama, attempting to undermine African American rights. 1951 December 25 Harry T. Moore state co coordinator of the Florida NAACP and his wife killed by dynamite bomb in his Mims, Florida home. Despite exhaustive F.B.I. investigation no one is arrested but Orlando KKK suspected.[10][11] 1963 June 12: NAACP organizer Medgar Evers shot in front of his Mississippi home by member of the Ku Klux Klan. September 16, 1963: 16th Street Baptist Church bombing. A member of the Ku Klux Klan bombed a Church in Birmingham, Alabama, killing four girls. June 21, 1964: In the Mississippi civil rights worker murders, three civil rights workers are murdered in Philadelphia, Mississippi by the Ku Klux Klan. March 25, 1965: The Ku Klux Klan murders Viola Liuzzo, a Southern-raised white mother of five who was visiting Alabama from her home in Detroit to attend a civil rights march. At the time of her murder Liuzzo was transporting Civil Rights Marchers. 1966 January 10: Vernon Dahmer dies in the firebombing of his own home in Mississippi at the hands of the Ku Klux Klan. 1979 November 3: Members of the Ku Klux Klan and the American #$%$ Party fire on meeting of members of a Communist group who were trying to organize local African American workers in Greensboro, North Carolina, killing five. March 20, 1981: Michael Donald was randomly selected to be lynched by two Ku Klux Klan members near his Alabama home. He was beaten, had his throat slit, and was hanged. 1984 July 18: Alan Berg, Jewish lawyer-talk show host was shot and killed in the driveway of his home on Capitol Hill, Denver, Colorado, by members of a White Nationalist group called The Order. Berg had stridently argued with a member of the group on the show earlier who was convicted in his murder.

Message.Title: Elvis busted
Message.Msg: Miss. man accused of mailing suspected ricin described conspiracy theory involving body parts Source: Washington Post A Mississippi man accused of mailing letters with suspected ricin to national leaders believed he had uncovered a conspiracy to sell human body parts on the black market and sometimes performed as an Elvis Presley impersonator. Paul Kevin Curtis, 45, was arrested Wednesday at his home in Corinth, near the Tennessee state line about 50 miles north of Presley’s birthplace in Tupelo. ... Curtis wrote that he was trying to “expose various parties within the government, FBI, police departments” for what he believed was “a conspiracy to ruin my reputation in the community as well as an ongoing effort to break down the foundation I worked more than 20 years to build in the country music scene.” ... The FBI said there was no indication of a connection between the letters and the Monday bombing in Boston that killed three people and injured more than 170. The letters to Obama and Wicker were postmarked April 8, before the marathon.

That man (Obama) told us that if Obamacare passed our premiums would not rise one cent, and in fact go down...he bold face lied! At some point you need to wise up, you are getting lied to as well.

Message.Title: Train Wreck is............
Message.Msg: ..........the correct analysis Baucus - D. because in MT one has to drive a long time before you find a "Community Health Care Center" which treats Medicaid and also Medicare patients!!! Same here in WI! Small regular HCMC's are already clsosing and the Dr.s join a PA - too much paperwork, insurance for employees and Medicare doesnt pay enough and people better have addirional insurance or a good credit card - forget Medicaide!!! Here in our Hudson Medical Center - rated one of the best in the Nation - the specialists are leaving and staying at/in the (big cities) MN PA's.! I used to get to see a specialist in at least a week here, now I have to drive to MN and my specialist in MN got me a "RUSH APPOINTMENT" on March 10th with another specialist in MN and I have to wait till May 8th - outragues, sounds like Germany and in Britain it might be 3 month!!!! (I think I didn't know that before I read it - well, I didn't vote for the BUM!) Bidder, I don't know about you increase and what insurance you carry, but if this system doesn't get trashed, brace yourself for another major increase in premium! (Our Ins. Agent already warned us and at the last meeting in the Twin Cities of Insurers, they predicted increases up to 116% - that's going to do a lot for everybody which now must have insurance! Maybe OBIMBO and the bunch should be on private insurance! ROWDY

Topic.Title: Another top Democrat, Obamacare a "train Wreck"

Message.Msg: I thought the illegal immigrant count was at 12 million. Did Rush brought 8 more millions in? Would not surprise me. Ever heard the term "economies of scale" ??? If you didn't - it stands for " the cost advantages that enterprises obtain due to size" Seems to me at 310 million we should have definite advantages over smaller population countries - why is it not so? And why you refuse to admit current system is broken even though, as you point out YOUR OWN increases are very drastic? Only few provisions of Affordable Health Care act are in effect right now and NONE OF THEM would yet have an effect on your cost. So, if you feel you are exploited - blame the industry that is exploiting you - not the law that was created to PROTECT YOU!

Message.Title: Obama nominee admits unemployment numbers are bogus.
Message.Msg: Perez certainly can't be accused of some right wing zealot. Why the folks are roaming the streets looking for work, the community organizer is focusing on guns, gays, and illegals...what happened to BS line about ."focusing on jobs like a lazar beam"? Obama’s Labor nominee: Official unemployment numbers ‘understate’ jobs crisis Thomas Perez, President Obama’s nominee to lead the Labor Department, told Congress today that the Bureau of Labor Statistics is “understat[ing]” the national unemployment rate. “The labor force participation is at one of the lowest levels,” Perez told Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt., during his confirmation hearing today, adding that “7.6 percent doesn’t take into account discouraged workers, so, in that sense, it understates the unemployment rate.” Perez made that comment after Sanders said that the true unemployment rate is 13.6 percent. The senator asked Perez to help shift the Bureau of Labor Statistics towards emphasizing the higher figures.

Message.Title: Terrorists bomber now teaching at Columbia
Message.Msg: I guess it all about who's ox is being gored. **Kathy Boudin urged the use of “anti-personnel bombs.” In other words, she wanted to kill people not just damage property. Before they could act, her fellows were killed in the townhouse explosion.** A Tale of Two Terrorists Somewhere near Boston early Monday morning, he packed a bomb in a bag. It was by all accounts relatively crude — a pressure cooker, explosives, some wires, ball bearings and nails . . . nails which, hours later, doctors would struggle to remove from the flesh of bleeding victims. His motive is unclear. His intent is not: It was to maximize injury, suffering, pain, trauma and, yes, death. Perhaps Monday’s bomber will be caught, perhaps not. Perhaps Monday’s bomber will be offered a teaching job at Columbia University. Forty-three years ago last month, Kathy Boudin, now a professor at Columbia but then a member of the Weather Underground, escaped an explosion at a bomb factory operated in a townhouse in Greenwich Village. Three weeks earlier, Boudin’s Weathermen had firebombed a private home in Upper Manhattan with Molotov cocktails. The rest of the family, was presumably, an afterthought. I was 9 at the time, only a year older than the youngest victim in Boston. One of Boudin’s colleagues, Cathy Wilkerson, related in her memoir that the Weathermen were disappointed with the minimal effects of the bombs at my home. They decided to use dynamite the next time and bought a large quantity along with fuses, metal pipes and, yes, nails. The group designated as its next target a dance at an Officer’s Club at Fort Dix, NJ. Despite the misgivings of some, it is reported that Kathy Boudin urged the use of “anti-personnel bombs.” In other words, she wanted to kill people not just damage property. Before they could act, her fellows were killed in the townhouse explosion.
